required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Genetic and Environmental Factors in Adults With Low and High Caries Experience
clinical_study.official_title: VDR and TFIP11 Gene Polymorphism and Gene-environmental Interaction

lead_sponsor.agency: Recep Tayyip Erdogan University Training and Research Hospital

clinical_study.source: Recep Tayyip Erdogan University Training and Research Hospital

brief_summary.textblock: VDR and TFIP11 Gene polymorphism and gene-environment interactions on caries etiology and susceptibility in adults.

detailed_description.textblock:
To date, genes can be grouped into categories based on the factor influencing dental caries. The major candidate gene categories to date include enamel formation genes, immune response genes, genes related to saliva, and genes related to taste and dietary habits.
TFIP11 and VDR genes are related to enamel formation genes

primary_outcome.description: Each tooth will be examined and recorded as decayed, missing, or filled

secondary_outcome.description: The plaque amount is scored by using Silness&Löe Plaque Index plaque index PI<1.0 healthy PI 1.1-2.0 mild PI>2 high plaque

arm_group.description: 80 adults will be allowed in the high caries experience group according to DMFT index DMFT>13.9
80 adults will be allowed in the high caries experience group according toDMFT index DMFT≤4

intervention.description: DNAs were obtained from epithelial cells in buccal mucosa and were extracted with Genomic DNA Isolation Kit

biospec_descr.textblock: DNA for genetic analysis was isolated from buccal epithelial cells

study_pop.textblock: 160 adult in the 24-40 age range living in Northeast Turkey will allowed in the study

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- adult be between 24 and 40 years old
- subject has DMFT (Decayed, Missing, Filled, Permanent Tooth) DMFT≤4 , or, DMFT>13.9
Exclusion Criteria:
- systemic or genetic disorders
- orthodontic appliances
- pregnant women

overall_official.affiliation: Recep Tayyip Erdogan University Dentistry Faculty

facility.name: Recep Tayyip Erdogan University Dentistry Faculty

link.description: The Role of Vitamin D Receptor Polymorphisms on Dental Caries.

reference.citation: Cogulu D, Onay H, Ozdemir Y, Aslan GI, Ozkinay F, Eronat C. The Role of Vitamin D Receptor Polymorphisms on Dental Caries. J Clin Pediatr Dent. 2016;40(3):211-4. doi: 10.17796/1053-4628-40.3.211.

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Recep Tayyip Erdogan University Training and Research Hospital

clinical_study.keyword: caries experience, VDR, TFIP11, enviromental risk factor

patient_data.ipd_description: Data will be available within 6 months of study completion
